adam-roberts.note: An accomplished science fiction author across many sub-genres and a recognised academic. I am in awe of his talents.

adrian-t.note: Prolific author in a wide variety of sub-genres in both SF and Fantasy

alastair-reynolds.note: High concept sci-fi author, often a bit bleak but gripping, and he's a really nice chap too

ann-cleeves.note: An astonishingly prolific (and successful) crime author

arthur-c-clarke.note: A giant of science fiction, and a bit of a visionary, technology wise, if not socially

ben-aaronovitch.note: Creator of the Rivers of London series

brian-herbert.note: See also Frank Herbert, his father.

chris-hammer.note: Australia seems to create great writers of contemporary fiction and crime and Chris is exhibit A.

claire-douglas.note: Queen of the twisty psychological thriller

david-feintuch.note: Prolific author of fairly juvenile (but great!) military and space opera fare

david-kynaston.note: Historian of post-war Britain, surprisingly entertaining

deborah-harkness.note: Queen of Witches (and vampires, werewolves and the other creatures)

elly-griffiths.note: Queen of Norfolk based (and further afield) crime

frank-herbert.note: A giant amongst sci-fi authors, even if Dune was all he wrote

gareth-powell.note: Writer of the embers of war series

hiromi-kawakami.note: Mistress of the offbeat slice-of-life Japanese novel

iain-banks.note: A giant both in science fiction and scottish contemporary fiction, his cruel early death was a huge loss to both genres

jack-campbell.note: Master of military sci-fi (and multi-novel sequences)

jack-mcdevitt.note: Cosy, hard sci-fi - undemanding but restful and interesting

jane-austen.note: I'm late to the party on this, but now one of my favourite authors

jane-harper.note: Probably the leading contemporary Australian novelist in this genre

john-scalzi.note: Prolific author, best known (to me) for the Old Man's War series

jojo-moyes.note: Feelgood, slice of complicated contemporary life that works out OK in the end style author

k-s-robinson.note: Mars, environmental catastrophe, lots and lots of talking - what's not to like?

karen-swan.note: Easy reading romance in exotic settings revealed in the title (usually)

ken-macleod.note: One of the Scottish cluster of contemporary Science Fiction writers

lucy-worsley.note: Gifted writer and presenter, and accomplished historian

michael-drout.note: A fantasic scholar and even better educator

mick-herron.note: Didn't he turn out well? The spy master in chief!

miles-cameron.note: Historical fiction author, and a bit of a polymath, pretty hot at SF too

neal-asher.note: Creator of the polity universe, possibly not the nicest place to live

peter-may.note: Not sure how he does it, but the master of unputdownable thrillers...

rachel-hore.note: Great for comfort reads and a warm fuzzy romantic feeling. Sometimes gets carried away with dialogues.

robert-heinlein.note: A giant of science fiction, and a bit of a libertarian, allegedly

sarah-j-maas.note: The Queen of romantasy fiction perhaps

satoshi-yagisawa.note: Delightful and moving slices of Japanese life

stephen-baxter.note: Hard science fiction, usually galactic (and mind-blowing) in scale

tom-shippey.note: Tolkien authority, literature professor and all round nice guy

ursula-le-guin.note: Arguably a literary fiction author working in a science fiction setting
